description.narrative: The project development objective is to promote better and more equitable local service delivery. The project will achieve its objective by establishing and operationalizing a decentralized participatory and transparent financing mechanism that empowers local governments and communities. This writing of the PDO shows small differences with the one in the PAD; it is just a consolidation, basedon AFTRL's advice. Similarly small consolidations have been made in the writing of the key indicators, based on AFTRL's advice.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall recruit a firm for the purpose of Commune-level financial oversight of Subprojects.

title.narrative: Each audit report is unqualified following the audit stipulated by the project Finance Agreement.

comment.narrative: Audit covering through 2011 submitted to the Bank June 2011. Unqualified.

title.narrative: 70% of targeted communes show an increase in access to, and use of, primary health, primary education, and water services, since the time of conclusion of as compared with that at the time of conclusi

comment.narrative: Access is assumed to equate use. Based upon finalized infrastructures.

title.narrative: At least 60% of targeted communes that provide robust monitoring and evaluation information in an appropriate timeframe.

comment.narrative: 34 out of 34 communes provide regular reporting info.

title.narrative: At least 15% of targeted communes have obtained funding for Communal Development Plan activities from outside the project.

comment.narrative: All communes have obtained at least one additional financing to their communal development plan from outside the project.

title.narrative: At least 90% of targeted Communes that have developed or updated their Communal Development Plans on a participatory basis.

comment.narrative: All targeted communities developed CDP. The project is assisting in the formulation of new Communal Development Plans.

title.narrative: A communication strategy targeting all Project stakeholders has been developed and implemented.

actual.value: 100% strategy completed, but activities still on-going. Project close-out communications strategy being developed.

comment.narrative: Assuming that 30% adopted means that the framework has been conceived, and 100% means it has been completely implemented. Theproject finalized a strategy, and recently implemented aspects of the strategy. On-going communications activities are planned for2012.The project is also preparing a project close-out communications strategy.

title.narrative: Training plan of DGDMAD has been finalized and implemented satisfactorily

comment.narrative: Assuming that 30% adopted means that the framework has been conceived, and 100% means it has been completely implemented. Theplanned training has been completed entirely.

title.narrative: 70% of infrastructure financed under sub-projects is maintained and operational two years after completion of the respective Subproject.

comment.narrative: None of the subprojects have been finalized for two years; 79% of subprojects finalized are operational. Maintenance measures andcommittees are in place in each commune.

title.narrative: At least 70 subprojects targeting vulnerable groups have been completed.

comment.narrative: While 294 sub-projects have been signed, 225 have been completed.

title.narrative: At least 430 community- and commune-level sub-projects completed.

comment.narrative: While 596 sub-projects have been signed, 476 have been completed.
No available
1,701,801 male beneficiaries and 1,771,263 female beneficiaries.
508 for primary schools, 463 for municipal colleges, 332 for health centers, 1697 in housing for vulnerable group members, and 44public latrines.

title.narrative: Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: No applicable. Sub- projects are demand driven, and each is chosen by a community according to its priorities identified duringthesub-project development process.
545 water sources finalized. Each source serves on average 94 households with an average of 5 people per household. There is nobreakdown between urban and rural. All water sources are rural.

title.narrative: People in project areas with access to Improved Water Sources

comment.narrative: No applicable. Sub- projects are demand driven, and each is chosen by a community according to its priorities identified duringthesub-project development process.
545 water sources finalized. Each source serves on average 94 households with an average of 5 people per household.

title.narrative: Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)

comment.narrative: Targets are not applicable. Sub-projects are demand driven, and each is chosen by a community according to its prioritiesidentified during the sub-project development process.
66 heath centers constructed, 36 functional and 32 non-functional.
Targets are not applicable. Sub- projects are demand driven, and each is chosen by a community according to its prioritiesidentified during the sub-project development process.
7 rural roads, totaling 87.5 km.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: No applicable. Sub- projects are demand driven, and each is chosen by a community according to its priorities identified duringthesub-project development process.
There are no urban water points. All water sources are rural.
No available

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: Targets are not applicable. Sub- projects are demand driven, and each is chosen by a community according to its prioritiesidentified during the sub-project development process.
442 sources and 103 water points, rehabilitated and functional.
